data.title: Mauka to Makai Eco Tour
data.text:
You meet with the amazing crew at KIPUKA OLOWALU early morning and get to spend few hours of your morning learning about the environment and the culture of the Native Hawaiian land and practices. You will also help remove invasive species and plant native trees , leaving a positive foot print on Maui while you are visiting. A feel good experience!

You can sign up online here: https://www.kipukaolowalu.com/volunteer

A picnic lunch will be served by the Olowalu stream. I will tell you all about the history behind this beautiful place while you are enjoying your food.

After lunch I am taking you across the street on the beach side to educate you about Hawai’i coral reef, marine life and how our communities are working together to protect Maui’s natural resources. Get inspired and inspired others to live and travel pono .”

100% of the profits from this experience will be donated to Kipuka Olowalu .

Kipuka Olowalu's mission to cultivate cultural and environmental connectivity to all by

perpetuating traditional and customary practices.

Pick up from your hotel available on west side only at extra cost or we meet at the general store in Olowalu at 8am.

Pick up and drop off can also be arranged if you do not have a rental car.

Tour is temporarily unavailable while Lahaina is Closed.

On my 2 hours SUP Eco Tour , I will tell you the story of Lahaina back when these Royal grounds were mostly wet lands and how history impacted Maui's reefs.

You will learn about Hawaii's marine life and coral formation and how our communities work together in hope to protect Maui's natural resources.

A fun way to cool down and learn more about this beautiful island and its culture.

Please email me for more information.
